Table Maintenance Facility

  • Site map

  • Table Maintenance Facility

Table Maintenance Facility

Tuesday, May 10, 2022, 06:40:14 (Timezone: America/New_York)

The Table Maintenance Facility, also known as TMF, is a tool developed to provide users the ability to maintain any DB2 table, which may reside anywhere in the world, over the IBM intranet. Tables maintained are grouped by sub-applications, each of which is assigned to one or more administrators.

The tool is equipped with self-administered functions. Each assigned administrator is expected to use these features to maintain his/her applications.

The system also provides a number of validation templates which can be used to specify data entry requirements (edit/audits) on any table. Such requirements can be enforced either locally or remotely.

Changes to tables are logged and can be viewed either by the users who perform them or by the administrators of the tables.


The left navigation sidebar only shows sub-applications for which you are granted access. If additional ones are needed please contact your application administrator.

TMF currently supports the following sub-applications:

  • AIW
  • AIW BOP
  • AIW Reference
  • APEX
  • ARIW
  • BHAM-FI/CO
  • BHAM-MDM HR Minimaster
  • BHAM-OTC
  • BHAM-OTO
  • BHAM-Procurement
  • CPW
  • Consolidated Reference Repository
  • Dona Testing AppCode
  • EMEA Interface Management
  • Equity Compensation Tool
  • F D W
  • Global Accrual Tool (GAT)
  • Global Debt Management System
  • Global Debt Management System - Canada
  • Indirect Tax Compliance
  • Kyndryl APEX

  • Kyndryl FIW BOP

  • Kyndryl Indirect Tax Compliance

Tuesday, May 10, 2022, 06:40:14 (Timezone: America/New_York)

The Table Maintenance Facility, also known as TMF, is a tool developed to provide users the ability to maintain any DB2 table, which may reside anywhere in the world, over the IBM intranet. Tables maintained are grouped by sub-applications, each of which is assigned to one or more administrators.

The tool is equipped with self-administered functions. Each assigned administrator is expected to use these features to maintain his/her applications.

The system also provides a number of validation templates which can be used to specify data entry requirements (edit/audits) on any table. Such requirements can be enforced either locally or remotely.

Changes to tables are logged and can be viewed either by the users who perform them or by the administrators of the tables.


The left navigation sidebar only shows sub-applications for which you are granted access. If additional ones are needed please contact your application administrator.

Table Maintenance Facility

Tuesday, May 10, 2022, 06:40:14 (Timezone: America/New_York)

The Table Maintenance Facility, also known as TMF, is a tool developed to provide users the ability to maintain any DB2 table, which may reside anywhere in the world, over the IBM intranet. Tables maintained are grouped by sub-applications, each of which is assigned to one or more administrators.

The tool is equipped with self-administered functions. Each assigned administrator is expected to use these features to maintain his/her applications.

The system also provides a number of validation templates which can be used to specify data entry requirements (edit/audits) on any table. Such requirements can be enforced either locally or remotely.

Changes to tables are logged and can be viewed either by the users who perform them or by the administrators of the tables.


The left navigation sidebar only shows sub-applications for which you are granted access. If additional ones are needed please contact your application administrator.

TMF currently supports the following sub-applications:

  • AIW
  • AIW BOP
  • AIW Reference
  • APEX
  • ARIW
  • BHAM-FI/CO
  • BHAM-MDM HR Minimaster

Table Maintenance Facility

Tuesday, May 10, 2022, 06:40:14 (Timezone: America/New_York)

The Table Maintenance Facility, also known as TMF, is a tool developed to provide users the ability to maintain any DB2 table, which may reside anywhere in the world, over the IBM intranet. Tables maintained are grouped by sub-applications, each of which is assigned to one or more administrators.

The tool is equipped with self-administered functions. Each assigned administrator is expected to use these features to maintain his/her applications.

The system also provides a number of validation templates which can be used to specify data entry requirements (edit/audits) on any table. Such requirements can be enforced either locally or remotely.

Changes to tables are logged and can be viewed either by the users who perform them or by the administrators of the tables.


The left navigation sidebar only shows sub-applications for which you are granted access. If additional ones are needed please contact your application administrator.

TMF currently supports the following sub-applications:

  • AIW
  • AIW BOP
  • AIW Reference
  • APEX
  • ARIW
  • BHAM-FI/CO

Table Maintenance Facility

  • Site map

  • Table Maintenance Facility

Table Maintenance Facility

Tuesday, May 10, 2022, 06:40:14 (Timezone: America/New_York)

The Table Maintenance Facility, also known as TMF, is a tool developed to provide users the ability to maintain any DB2 table, which may reside anywhere in the world, over the IBM intranet. Tables maintained are grouped by sub-applications, each of which is assigned to one or more administrators.

The tool is equipped with self-administered functions. Each assigned administrator is expected to use these features to maintain his/her applications.

The system also provides a number of validation templates which can be used to specify data entry requirements (edit/audits) on any table. Such requirements can be enforced either locally or remotely.

Changes to tables are logged and can be viewed either by the users who perform them or by the administrators of the tables.


The left navigation sidebar only shows sub-applications for which you are granted access. If additional ones are needed please contact your application administrator.

TMF currently supports the following sub-applications:

  • AIW
  • AIW BOP
  • AIW Reference
  • APEX
  • ARIW
  • BHAM-FI/CO
  • BHAM-MDM HR Minimaster

Table Maintenance Facility

Tuesday, May 10, 2022, 06:40:14 (Timezone: America/New_York)

The Table Maintenance Facility, also known as TMF, is a tool developed to provide users the ability to maintain any DB2 table, which may reside anywhere in the world, over the IBM intranet. Tables maintained are grouped by sub-applications, each of which is assigned to one or more administrators.

The tool is equipped with self-administered functions. Each assigned administrator is expected to use these features to maintain his/her applications.

The system also provides a number of validation templates which can be used to specify data entry requirements (edit/audits) on any table. Such requirements can be enforced either locally or remotely.

Changes to tables are logged and can be viewed either by the users who perform them or by the administrators of the tables.


The left navigation sidebar only shows sub-applications for which you are granted access. If additional ones are needed please contact your application administrator.

TMF currently supports the following sub-applications:

  • AIW

Table Maintenance Facility

Tuesday, May 10, 2022, 06:40:14 (Timezone: America/New_York)

The Table Maintenance Facility, also known as TMF, is a tool developed to provide users the ability to maintain any DB2 table, which may reside anywhere in the world, over the IBM intranet. Tables maintained are grouped by sub-applications, each of which is assigned to one or more administrators.

The tool is equipped with self-administered functions. Each assigned administrator is expected to use these features to maintain his/her applications.

The system also provides a number of validation templates which can be used to specify data entry requirements (edit/audits) on any table. Such requirements can be enforced either locally or remotely.

Changes to tables are logged and can be viewed either by the users who perform them or by the administrators of the tables.


The left navigation sidebar only shows sub-applications for which you are granted access. If additional ones are needed please contact your application administrator.

TMF currently supports the following sub-applications:

  • AIW
  • AIW BOP
  • AIW Reference
  • APEX
  • ARIW
  • BHAM-FI/CO
  • BHAM-MDM HR Minimaster
  • BHAM-OTC

Table Maintenance Facility

  • Site map

  • Table Maintenance Facility

Table Maintenance Facility

Tuesday, May 10, 2022, 06:40:14 (Timezone: America/New_York)

The Table Maintenance Facility, also known as TMF, is a tool developed to provide users the ability to maintain any DB2 table, which may reside anywhere in the world, over the IBM intranet. Tables maintained are grouped by sub-applications, each of which is assigned to one or more administrators.

The tool is equipped with self-administered functions. Each assigned administrator is expected to use these features to maintain his/her applications.

The system also provides a number of validation templates which can be used to specify data entry requirements (edit/audits) on any table. Such requirements can be enforced either locally or remotely.

Changes to tables are logged and can be viewed either by the users who perform them or by the administrators of the tables.


The left navigation sidebar only shows sub-applications for which you are granted access. If additional ones are needed please contact your application administrator.

TMF currently supports the following sub-applications:

  • AIW
  • AIW BOP

Table Maintenance Facility

Tuesday, May 10, 2022, 06:40:14 (Timezone: America/New_York)

The Table Maintenance Facility, also known as TMF, is a tool developed to provide users the ability to maintain any DB2 table, which may reside anywhere in the world, over the IBM intranet. Tables maintained are grouped by sub-applications, each of which is assigned to one or more administrators.

The tool is equipped with self-administered functions. Each assigned administrator is expected to use these features to maintain his/her applications.

The system also provides a number of validation templates which can be used to specify data entry requirements (edit/audits) on any table. Such requirements can be enforced either locally or remotely.

Changes to tables are logged and can be viewed either by the users who perform them or by the administrators of the tables.


The left navigation sidebar only shows sub-applications for which you are granted access. If additional ones are needed please contact your application administrator.

TMF currently supports the following sub-applications:

  • AIW

Table Maintenance Facility

Tuesday, May 10, 2022, 06:40:14 (Timezone: America/New_York)

The Table Maintenance Facility, also known as TMF, is a tool developed to provide users the ability to maintain any DB2 table, which may reside anywhere in the world, over the IBM intranet. Tables maintained are grouped by sub-applications, each of which is assigned to one or more administrators.

The tool is equipped with self-administered functions. Each assigned administrator is expected to use these features to maintain his/her applications.

The system also provides a number of validation templates which can be used to specify data entry requirements (edit/audits) on any table. Such requirements can be enforced either locally or remotely.

Changes to tables are logged and can be viewed either by the users who perform them or by the administrators of the tables.


The left navigation sidebar only shows sub-applications for which you are granted access. If additional ones are needed please contact your application administrator.

TMF currently supports the following sub-applications:

  • AIW
  • AIW BOP
